38872978.review:
Puzzle gráfico belíssimo e brevíssimo explorando simetria e matemática presentes na arte islâmica. A ideia é clicar em um ponto e observar uma forma simétrica surgir a partir de elementos geométricos em movimento cíclico como círculos ou barras.

Tem 47 fases incluindo o tutorial (as 2 últimas em aberto) e um modo de desenho livre que permite exportar os padrões criados em arquivos de imagem (embora faz falta poder colorir no próprio jogo). 

Vale a pena pra se distrair se estiver em promoção. ;]

38848481.review:
[h1]强迫症福音[/h1]
如题，玩这游戏会莫名爽到。
[list]
[*]游戏的目的是从周期性运动的物体中寻找某个点运动形成的图案模式，给玩家展示由各种各样的周期运动生成的图案纹样。谜题难度不高，通关也只需要不到两小时，本质上可是说是一个绘图游戏。另外游戏自带图案编辑器，提供了一些生成模式，能作出奇奇怪怪的图样。
[*]作者想必是个作图高手，非常善于从数学模式中发现美感。谜题设置足够精巧，六大关卡遵循不同的生成模式，每一小关有微妙的不同，得到的结果却千奇百怪。学生时代喜欢拿直尺圆规涂画发呆的玩家，这款游戏大概是你们的菜。
[*]制作者好像是伊朗的，游戏音乐很有波斯风情，又不失现代感，听起来很舒适。
[/list]
喜欢像艺术品一样精致的游戏~

38051035.review:
看了谜苏的安利实况之后就觉得这是个原价买也不亏的游戏了。

Engare分为解谜和沙盒两部分。解谜的难度不大，一个小时多就可以全部通关，有时候你会“我是谁我在哪我刚刚是怎么通关的”。通过这一个多小时的解谜过程让你感受到几何数学的美妙之处。bgm非常好听，恰到好处地把玩家发现美的喜悦加强了。整个过程非常舒心。
沙盒部分可以自己制作图案并且可以导出图片和三维模型，就凭这点赶紧原价买了吧。不过我还是觉得比起留下静止的图案，在制作过程中滑着设置参数的滑块，看着图案不断变化的动态过程才是最迷人的。
选关界面很有气氛，鼠标移动的时候会划出流星的形状，就可以自己在夜空里划流星辣。

又是一个我痛恨着为什么不卖OST的游戏了……

38032174.review:
TLDR: Worth it.

Some people hear the word puzzle game and think that it's a pain in the neck that you pay for and that's fair because most of them are. A few puzzle games are on a higher level than that, though. Engare is one of them.

Two reasons you should buy this:

This is an exercise in artistic concept.  The more you understand that concept, the more entertaining it becomes as you get better and better, firing the neurons in your brain that are required for this charming endeavour.

The music is enthralling. I'll let you know now that it is repetitive but, so is the complex, pattern-based essence of the game. 



Two reasons you should not buy this game:

 You have already mastered the form. You're such a pro that this is just a banal tool for the masses to enjoy and are not at all challenged by timing the beginning of the pattern.

Nearly inconsequential and very infrequent button detection bugs throw you into a severe rage, destroying your ability to relax and take in any form of beauty.



I should say that Engare may not have taught me a single fact but, I feel like a useful lesson has been imparted on me every time climb to the next difficulty.  That's what a puzzle game should feel like - that epiphanic, 'Ah Ha' moment. I have always understood the basic idea behind geomatric art, having been one of those kids who received an apathetically purchased spin-art set on more than one occasion. Now, when i see this medium in everyday life, I have a greater, more informed appreciation for it. Good job, Mahdi Barami, and thanks.

36846760.review:
It's an interesting piece of work, but I can't entirely recommend it the way I'd like to: The actual campaign is frustrating and defined by imprecise controls, and yet it wants you to make extremely precise marks and decisions, often while timed and without any functional indicator of success or failure. This is a significant problem because I primarily was interested in the game for its potential as a spirograph generator, using the many tools shown in the video... Only to find out those tools are locked behind a very significant amount of (to me) uninteresting and (objectively) badly designed / implemented puzzles.

So it's... Fine? But I really wish it were better.

36446864.review:
[b]Recommendation: Mixed[/b]


Engare is a game about mathemoatical drawings and repeating motions, sounds interresting right?
Well I played through the entire game, and here are my thoughts on it!

Positive:
+ great introduction, which made me excited to get in and start playing and seeing all the cool complex shapes I'd be seeing
+ The music is great, and so is the artstyle, kudos to that
+ the first few levels are great and show you a bunch of complex and beautiful shapes (for the most part at least)
+ the drawing tools are absolutely amazing

Negative:
- past the first 2 areas, it feels like the dev had already shown you all the cool complex shapes too eartly on and ran out of ideas for shapes so he just started giving you a bunch of basic/uninterresting shapes to make with more complex puzzles, meaning that the payoff for the harder puzzles became more and more dissapointing as it went on

- the last 2 puzzles of the game are just levels where you make the shape that you want to move on, no idea why those are main levels and not just one mode avaiable in the area of the game that let's you play around with shapes (screenshot 3 and 6 from the store page are form that zone of the game)

- the first few areas had all those interresting setups, with grids of squares moving in odd patterns and blocks colliding with each other and swapping blocks with one another making finding where to draw the sahpe quickly, except that those went away after that and the last areas became 80% nothing but rotating sticks attached to one another (the ramining 20% being circles in circles)

- the drawing tools are locked behind those main game levels, which is a shame



So all in all, the drawing tools are amazing and I have nothing bad to say about them, however I do feel inccredibly underwhelmed by the main game itself, and the drawing tools being locked behind those means that you'll have to get through them all to unlock all of the tools.

Final Score: 5/10

I completed this game in under an hour, so there's definitely not a ton of content.  That said, it is novel and beautiful and I'm glad to have played it.  I probably would have priced it a couple bucks lower than it is since it's so short, but it's still not terribly expensive.

I was a bit disappointed to see that the 3D shapes in the trailer are not actually used in any puzzles.  All puzzles are 2-dimensional, and the 3D shapes are just for free drawing.

TL;DR - The game is very short, but well-made.  What you see in the trailer is an accurate representation of what to expect.

36262247.review:
This is not a puzzle game as such.

It's a game about discovering the magical power of geometry.

Geometry is one of the seven original liberal arts, so called because knowledge of these is essential for free persons in a liberal society. Much of the art, science, and technology underpinning the thousands of years of human advancement is directly attributable to the study of geometric principles.

Mr Bahrami is sharing beauty, magic, and science with us. This is what you show your child to get him excited about the possibilities of mathematics.

I'm in wonder at the beauty of it all. 

Mr Bahrami puts the creative power in his audience' hands by offering up tools that make all the patterns.

This isn't a game. It's more of a beautifully choreographed personal tour of geometric art. Embark on this journey as soon as you're able!!

36197844.review:
I feel like I'm going to hell for this, but honestly this is not a good game, and I'm both surprised and disappointed. I was hyped for it ever since this April 2016 preview from Killscreen. So many ticked boxes: A video game (Check!) about the mathematical (Check!) beauty (Check!) of Islamic Art (Check!). How could this not be absolutely awesome in an awesomely original way?

So I was very excited when I saw it in the new releases on Steam. But awesome it is not.

Instead, it is a small collection of "puzzles" that are easily solved within an hour. Calling them puzzles is generous because you solve them with a single click, plus maybe a few clicks of trial-and-error if you don't get it right the first attempt. What do they consist of? Typically, you are confronted with a few geometrical shapes that rotate in intricate ways, and a small drawing/pattern that is your target. You have to click on the part of one of the shapes where you want to place a virtual pencil. The shapes continue their movements, carrying the pencil with them (think spirograph) and if the resulting pattern sufficiently resembles the target, you win. it's all very simple and also very easy, except in some puzzles that inexplicably require millimeter-to-millimeter reproduction of the goal pattern (most levels are somewhat lenient with this, as it should be). The very last levels have sliders to adjust the size of the geometric objects and/or the speed of their rotation, but it doesn't make the puzzles more challenging or much more interesting.

What the game does well, is exposing the simple geometry behind some typical islamic decorative patterns. As a limited educational tool, it's not bad. But it completely fails as a game, never offering any enjoyable challenge. The content is almost laughably thin: don't expect to spend much more than a single hour with it. As you progress, you'll unlock a few drawing tools to use in a kind of sandbox mode, but again, this is very limited in what it allows (you can't customize the colors, for example) and in the time you'll want to fiddle with it.

There is so little content that one can only wonder what happened during the 18 months separating the preview with the game's release.

Add a few annoying but non game-breaking bugs, and it's really impossible to recommend. I am convinced there is a good game to be made on the subject of Islamic art. But Engare is not that game. It does have nice music, and that allows me to conclude on a positive note.

36178114.review:
I think the concept of "drawing tool + puzzle game" is brilliant, but i also think the price is currently high in relation to what it currently offers. A few ideas to improve future versions, which i hope are planned (i would like to see a linux version too):

right click should control the "play/stop" state of the needles.

imo the option to change background color of puzzles or use simple textures would be appreciated.

I would like it to have world-maps like angry birds and similar games, and also that the game was offered for free with a litlle more content than current version; additional levels and a level creation tool to allow players to share new puzzles could be part of dlc. i think that could help make the game more popular and visible, and also improve sales: new levels and game mechanics as extras.

a "vs mode" could be interesting for those who buy the game; could work as a race to see who solves more puzzles within a time limit, or also by forcing the other player to start playing a different puzzle each time a puzzle is solved. More songs, music player in the start menu, and a gallery for 3d and 2d models of actual architecture and rl art should be offered as rewards imo, and also and psychedelic animations with fractal patterns for the ending of each level rather tha the minimalistic ones it currently has (which should be optional to play at the end of each sublevel). this would help the game to be taken more seriously as both a cultural and educational tool.

All options related to the drawing tool should be open from the beginning, and choosing to start the game or the tool should be included in the start menu. an option to change volume in the middle of the game, and even background themes (like in tetris games) should also be present. the drawing tool should export to svg and png too, and be able to export and import text files with settings to generate different patterns.

also 3d models and more options should be available, like the option to use color in designs made with the drawing tool, and mix patterns with transparency and bevel effects; in general, more options to experiment more seriously and make it more useful so it feels lees like a toy; could have a "switch mode": "simple (toy) mode" and "pro (designer/entusiast) mode". 

i visited the website of the dev, and imo the other game about 3d illusions could easily be ixed with the concept of this "game+tool" if the concept of art+educational (puzzle) game was expanded.

36073400.review:
1.首先音乐和概念设计五星好评，总感觉像这类小清新游戏必须要全程保持比较精美的制作才行，但是游戏的选关画面有点粗糙，和游戏整体风格不太搭配。
2.前几关的关卡的关卡设计都非常优秀，很好的把握了有趣和困难的平衡，游玩的时候配合充满波斯风格的音乐简直太赞了，加入物理系统好评，虽然没有深挖有点可惜。从普通的寻找物品的运动轨迹到寻找给定的图案，一层层深入的感觉也非常棒。
3.如果说前几关的关卡设计就像一座传统的波斯宫殿让人赞叹。那么最后一大关就像是还没装修的房子一样，比方说前几关的每关成功效果都会做成波斯建筑彩色玻璃花窗的样式，但是在最后一大关只是描边了而已，用模拟器代替缺少的关卡，而且由于直接试个五六次就可以得到正确的结果反而使得它成为全游戏难度最低的关卡，每一个细节都让这个游戏的最后一大关充满了赶工和敷衍。
4.还有一点有点令人诟病的就是游戏时长的问题，一个多小时的游戏时长使得本作成为一个小品级游戏。附送的图案模拟器完全无感，因为我没有美术细胞，设计出的图案都很一般（哭哭）。

 游戏总体来说  8.1/10  推荐一玩

好了我要去找点波斯音乐听了。

36062640.review: A game that deserves to be at least twice as long as it is, barely scratching the surface of what its mechanics are capable of - but joyously clever while it lasts all the same. Minor polish issues (no confirmation prompt on 'New Game' that automatically deletes progress, sometimes solutions that look correct aren't accepted for unclear reasons) but nothing that ruins the experience. Worth the price. Great music, too.

36051422.review:
You win two things when you buy this game? 1) a short and swift game puzzle game experience and 2) a tool for artistic/geometric expression and discovery.

The first one is rather small, but nonetheless managed to provide a kind of puzzle that I've never seen before. Usually, with puzzle games, you face a system that feels difficult and strange at first (think Braid or sokoban games), but you progressively feel more confortable and start to think and feel like the system wants you to. This process usually takes a couple of hours, but with Engare it is very much faster: within the first few levels you go from not understanding how to solve the puzzles to think in terms of movement rather than static forms. Of course, you can just brute-force your way through the challenges. But the real experience is the change of perspective this game offers: you start to see movement in static images and static images coming out of mathematical patterns of motion.

Which brings you to the second part: experimenting with these patterns to create your own images, rather than copying what the levels want. This is probably the main experience of the game, and what really makes it worth the (very small) price. It is an incredible and potent tool, and at the same time very intuitive and simple.

I have been following the development of this game for a few years, and finished it in a couple of hours. It was more than worth it: it is one of the most unique games I've ever played.

36050772.review: Great game, great music! I found it a wee bit easy, but I'd gladly replay it several times, and just draw stuff. Congrats to everyone behind this game.

36018170.review:
Engare is a wonderful little game. It's simple, intuitive, and a lot of fun. The designs look beautiful, and solving puzzles is very satisfying. The ability to make one's own designs is also a wonderful element that means the game is fun to play even after you've finished all the puzzles--in fact, my only complaint is that the game is too short!

Additionally, the music is excellent. This deserves its own line, it's that good.

36017880.review: This game is almost painfully beautiful. I'd stare at a puzzle solution, just feeling awe struck by the emerging pattern. It feels like an entire new genre, the core puzzle mechanic is unlike anything I've seen, but already feels fully formed. As you play, you start to develop a sense for how the curves intersect, and this feeling of knowing how these wonderful patterns are produced on an intuitive level is really amazing. Remarkable game, absolutely love it.

35990863.review:
By way of introduction, let me say that I'm a college mathematics professor.  I played through the game in a few hours, and enjoyed almost every minute of it even though I knew almost immediately how to solve many of the puzzles.  If you've never done parametric/polar coordinate math, some of the shapes or how to make them will be genuinely surprising.

The game is in my opinion a great way to intuitively learn how compound motions can produce a variety of interesting figures.  I enjoyed it so much that I plan to use it in a math class this very semester, along side traditional Mathematica-based computations.  An "education mode" or "education edition" would be a very welcome expansion of the game, where completed puzzles could also show you some of the mathematics behind them...but I wouldn't want that to in any way distract a player who wants to play it as-is.

A few points for improvement: I discovered that holding the command key (Mac) allows slow motion and clicking; doing control to slow-mo didn't allow clicking.  Had I discovered this earlier, or had control allowed clicking, some of the puzzles would have been less frustrating.  In several, I knew exactly how to set up the shapes and where to click, but simply couldn't get a click to register on fast-moving objects.  This will hopefully be easily fixable by the developer.  A second point: two of the later levels do not have a required shape to produce; it would have been helpful to have the game say something like "make any shape."  At first I thought there was a bug.

Overall a VERY nice production, and very well worth it.  Congrats to the developers!

35986540.review:
[h1]内外摆线与数学美[/h1]（误）
这款游戏由伊朗一个年轻小伙独立制作，通过绘制一个点的轨迹所形成的摆线来解决谜题。
游戏中无论是UI 随处可见的内 外摆线图案 还是精美的BGM，都体现出神秘的波斯文化，让人感受到不一样的异域风情。
说到这里就简单介绍一下内 外摆线。（为防止某些人出现呕吐不适特意隐藏）
[spoiler]摆线就是一个圆沿一条直线运动时，圆边界上一个定点所形成的轨迹。游戏中主要是内摆线和外摆线。内摆线指的是一个动圆内切于一个定圆作无滑动的滚动，动圆圆周上一个定点的轨迹。外摆线就是指外切的情况。内 外摆线是几何学美的表现之一，许多数学家都热衷于研究摆线及其相关性质。游戏中除了最基本的内 外摆线外还有运用机械动力学做出来的复杂图案。内外摆线所呈现的轴对称图案体现出了几何学的独特美，带给人视觉上的享受。[/spoiler]
同时这款游戏支持导出3D模型，方便于以后对图案进一步优化和欣赏。
此外这个伊朗小哥还有其他几款和几何学相关的游戏，在国内外均饱受好评，体验完本作后建议接着欣赏其他作品。
 
写在最后
一位数学家总结过研究数学的三个阶段，分别是：美，发现和幽默。
现在请打开游戏，去感受其独特的数学美吧！
 
 
 
 
 
 
[spoiler]伽利略，伯努利，牛顿，莱布尼茨，惠更斯等人让我问候一下你们的高数老师。你们真的没学过？[/spoiler]

大爱，感觉找到了一个特别好用自带BGM的图案设计生成器。

35976278.review:
[h1]前言[/h1]
这是一款 [b]伊朗绘线图清新解谜游戏[/b]

有些人小时候应该玩过一种的塑料画几何线图小工具（由两个零件组成，一个外面圆的里面有齿轮，另一个套在前者里面小外面是齿轮里面有小洞用来放笔描线），这游戏就与这个玩具十分类似。

[i]从机器动力学中看到几何美术，这款绘图式解谜游戏风格新奇简约。
又由几何美术来解释部分的机器动力学，在我们欣赏线条组成几何图案之美时又会细思其原理。[/i]

[h1]优点[/h1]
上述两点
外加音乐优美
自带几何线图绘图工具（前提你得先过几关）
有几关结束后会自动为你本关绘出来的几何线图进行上色（挺好看）
选大关画面可以打碟（其实也就一个音 “ 咚！”）
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1179993215][b]这游戏居然可以与windows的3D-Builder连通进行制作3d物件！！！（所以可以说这不仅仅是一款解谜游戏，也是一个艺术品制作工具）[/b][/url]


[h1]缺点[/h1]
没有成就（通关了好歹给个成就吧……）
按Esc键可以暂停调出菜单，但是画图页面消失，再按一下回到游戏，但是调整好的长度会返回默认值
有几关的完成判定有问题，画的像不给过，不像倒是过关了……
[spoiler]（玩到调整长度画花的关卡，上面我说的你就都明白了）[/spoiler]
[strike]对了，密集恐惧症最好就不要玩这游戏了哈哈[/strike]


[h1]关卡简述[/h1]
一共6大关（左边三个门洞，右边三个门洞）
总计47小关（8，12，7，7，7，6）
中间的大门洞是绘线图模拟器（非解谜模式）

你目前有4个按键可以使用（目前没试出更多）：
[list] 
    [*]鼠标左键
    [*]esc键（在关卡中调出菜单）
    [*][b]ctrl键（长按放慢运动速度，这很重要，当时我没好好看提示，通关后二周目才知道ToT，有一关点了半天才过，因为底板运动得太快）[/b]
    [*]鼠标右键（在解谜模式长按放慢运动速度，在绘线图模拟器可以用来擦除当前已上色的格子）
[/list]


个人[b]推荐[/b]这款游戏！来来来喜加一！

35974336.review:
[h1]Engare[/h1]

Engare is a puzzle and drawing game that aquires brain and patience.
In my opinion it is one of the best casual Games. I will mention here, why:

+ Amazing and relaxing music
+ Clean and clear graphics
+ Simple, but genius Leveldesign
+ Beautiful atmosphere (also in the menu and level selection)
+ Tiny puzzles with long considerations
+ Makes you think about the simplest figures and shapes and their relation towards each other
+ Great opportunity to come down if stressed out
+ It's cheap ;)

The only negative thing i could point out is the partially random seeming solution confirmation by the game (means: you draw a shape, but the game doesn't accept it as true).

And if [b]you[/b] read until here and you luckily know about the game: Is there any possibility to fill your own creations with colours like they do in the end of the later levels? :]

All in all I can only recomment this imaginative and intelligent game. It is definitely worth those couple of bucks.

Have a nice day,
[u]BetterChoice[/u]

35973150.review:
As described on the store page of the game, Engare is a game about motion and geometry. The basic mechanic of the game involves you putting a dot on one of the moving objects on the screen, which then draws a pattern by moving the dot as it moves and the dot traces the pattern. You solve a level by getting the objects to draw a pattern similar to the one drawn above the screen in each level. 

There are several twists that will be added as you near the end of the game. The game has 6 chapters each with 6 - 12 levels and also a sandbox mode with 6 different pattern drawing tools. 

The main game takes about 30 minutes to 2 hours to finish depending on your knowledge of math, physics and geometry and also depending on how many puzzle games you've played before. If you aren't good at math or haven't played many puzzle games before, don't worry, the game is very good at introducing you to its ideas and concepts and none of the levels are too difficult so that you might get stuck on them, there is even a chance you'll enjoy the game even more. There is a bit of awe that comes with solving each level, especially if you are completely new to the mathematical and geometrical concepts it's based on.

The sandbox modes are as fun as the main part, if not more, but in a different way. You are free to be creative, use your imagination, explore an infinite number of patterns and capture their beauty, and there are quite a lot of things you can create that are distinctly different from eachother. In fact, you don't even have to try to create patterns that are  jaw-droppingly beautiful, simply trying things out creates amazing patterns. You also can export your finished work of art to other 3D and 2D graphics softwares to use them in your own thing.

What would have made the game better:

- more levels that explore the mechanics to its limits; the levels are all simple and easy and I can't help but feel there could have been a lot more levels that wouldn't take away from the game's awesomeness in anyway.
- puzzles involving mechanics other than the main one; it's an admirable fact that all the ~50 levels in the game are based on only one mechanic, but the game is supposed to be about "motion and geometry" and I feel a lot more can come out of that if the game had more than one mechanic around that idea.
- being able to combine different patterns from the sandbox and color them so that you can have a finished image within the game would've been really nice. But you can do that in your graphics software of choice if you're not lazy like me.

Buy and play this game if:

- you want to play a puzzle game very different from your average casual puzzle game.
- you like math and geometry and want to play a game involving mathematical concepts that underly amazingly beautiful patterns.
- you are interested in experiencing another culture's art; the mechanics and the art in this game, as well as the drawing tools are all inspired by Islamic art and the music is heavily inspired by traditional Iranian music.
- you have about an hour of free time to enjoy a relaxing, meditative experience.
- you have never played with spirographs, don't know much about geometry and want your mind to be blown away by the things you see in this game.
- you love to create, you are an artist looking for inspirations or even someone who could use a couple of cool-looking patterns and models in their own work of art.

35954630.review:
Disclaimer: I know the developer who made the game. 

Engare is a really unique puzzle game about art and motion. The game features many levels, some of them really accessible, others particularly challenging. The progression is linear and you unlock one new level at the time. This might sound harsh in case you get stuck, but this actually makes you focus on the specific level until you really comprehend the motion you are asked to reproduce. 

It is possible to complete all levels between 1.5-2 hours, but the game features an amazing sandbox mode (actually, 6 sandbox modes!) where you can explore how motion can create shapes. The game even allows you to export the pattern you create and even apply to a dome (and export it as a 3d object). You can really get lost in this mode, and the results are often truly spectacular. 

Engare is a truly beautiful and unique game.

35954503.review: I followed this game on Twitter for more than a year and it did not disappoint. Beautiful music, puzzles that I thought were too hard until they clicked, and an easily-unlockable drawing mode that lets you make delicious geometric designs all your own. Well worth your money.

35953995.review:
I love this game.

I'm no expert about geometry or math (or know about them really) but this game makes you go "oh wow, that's clever" quite a lot of times. It makes you think, but doesn't hurt your brain. It has a really good difficulty level

I's really pretty as well, especially when you complete the first two levels, the game starts to increase the level of points and gives you a gorgeous geometric image with connecting them.

I love the music, it really adds to the game, easy to listen and stucks in your mind. I wish it had more tracks but that's just my greed.

It also has a sandbox mode which is really easy to use and super fun to experiment although I'm more interested with the puzzles. I think the developer should add more puzzles in the future to make it replayable and give it something more. I personally would love to see more puzzles since it's a bit pricey for the content.

I'd definitely recommend it, especially it is on sale. Great game for puzzle lovers.

35952780.review:
A very relaxing and pretty puzzle game about finding geometric patterns in simple rotational machines, similar to playing with a Spirograph. Upon completion, you also get access to a few art tools that also allow you to create, and export geometric art as .svg, and .obj files for use in other projects.


Short, unique, elegant, and a little hypnotic.

35952679.review: like all the other comments, its a trippy game about geometry and the poetry of it. its like those spiralgraph things some people played with as a kid, its a nice nostalgia game with a puzle twist with a dash of nice music to go along with it. kind of wish there was a spiral free mode and more levels. but all in all, awesome game for a good price.

35952671.review:
With only 1h in, this game has already left me enchanted with clever puzzle mechanics, beautiful soundtrack and wonderful designs that I'm able to create with it. I already see that I will enjoy coming back for some relaxing experience.

Trailer & photos tell you all you need to know, just buy it. ;)

35952460.review:
Terrific puzzle and pattern design game, worth at least the price. At first I was guessing about some of the shapes I had to complete, but by the end I could read the Arabic numerals, and could visualize and count rotations to get the solution to each puzzle pretty quickly! I also really appreciate the atmospheric sense of history given by the architectural elements, reminding us in an engaging way how Arab culture spread the light of science and mathematics in centuries past.

If you're a designer or artist you may especially appreciate the ability to export patterns you create in 3 formats at once: PNG image, SVG vector drawing, and OBJ 3D model.

35950961.review:
Engare is a beautiful game about understanding patterns and shapes by interacting with live drawing tools. You can create amazing and complex drawings, intricate mathematical patterns, or play with physics puzzles to figure out how shapes can be drawn.

I've played beta builds and seen the game change over time, and the final result is really fun to play with. There's a huge sense of surprise in seeing how small movements can multiply and combine and overlap to create huge patterns and designs. Really cool and innovative.

35950850.review:
An elegant, smart and beautiful puzzle-game. Very relaxing. Create amazing patters using the geometrical tools, while listening to the soothing music. I've never seen anything like it. 
Also features a sandbox mode where you can make your own patterns. 

Highly recommended. This game also makes a great gift.

35949959.review:
This is a very interesting geometric puzzle / drawing program.

Once you complete the 2nd set of puzzles it opens up some geometric drawing tools.

The first two levels are slightly taxing but solvable with some patience.

Like a spirograph it can save 3D .obj files with a material , a normal .png and a vector .svg.

This is very handy for 3D object creation.

This is very good value for the geometric drawing program and it is also an interesting puzzle game.

35949321.review:
Such a clever game, get if you want to try something very different. About 1.5-2 hours worth of puzzles (if you were just playing to beat them) + a creative sandbox mode. Puzzles are not designed to be super challenging, but each one is designed to teach something unique that you haven't realised before about motion and trajectory. Each puzzle itself you could spend a lot of time exploring 'what happens if you do this..' and realise interesting theories that you might not have considered before about simple moving shapes. It's not a multiple-solution kind of game like Spacechem. Puzzles are designed very deliberately to give you a moment of epiphany when you solve it.

These puzzles are not sliding object puzzles (like Snakebird / Stephen's Sausage Roll) or puzzle platforming or time manipulation (Induction), or even any puzzle where you're controlling a character (Linelight), or something that could work on paper. It's not a riff off any existing puzzle game mechanic - there really hasn't been anything even remotely similar before in games that I've seen. Wouldn't be surprised if it will spawn a new group of puzzle games that riff off this one. If you like your games different and unique this is one for you.

35949246.review:
Engare is a puzzle game. But it is also about shapes.

But mostly, it's about appreciating geometry and the art of math. 

The game has a zen-like feel to it, and it is really satisfying when you find just the right spot that solves the puzzle. 

Great game, highly recommended.

35949113.review: Kafa kurcalayan harika bulmacalar ve müzikler!

39291641.review:
After seeing so many remakes and reskins of the same games over the years, Engare gave me hope that there is still untapped genius in the game industry. 

On a side note, the music is also as beautiful. I kept listening even after the puzzles were over.

The only disappointing detail is that it is over so soon. Maybe a sandbox mode for the puzzles would extend the joy.

39220027.review:
A wonderful game, some of the most satisfying, beautiful and elegant puzzles I've ever played (which is of course inherited from the enormous beauty and elegance of the underlying math). Fantastic variety, constantly chaning up the formula and challenging you to find new approaches to solve the problems. I found myself developing my own "theories" (if you could call them that, more like "rules that seem to work and kind of make sense") as I went along and using weird intuitions I barely knew I had. It inspired me to want to delve deeper into the actual maths involved to properly understand it all, in a wonderful way!

Only negative is a lack of content, there's about an hour of puzzles + sandbox mode which I'm very exited to play around more with. Still 100% worth it for the price - I just hope the developers might realize they've hit on something brilliant and expand with more level, because I WANT MORE!

39219163.review: I completed all the puzzles in under 2 hours, yet I hesitate to say that this was not worth the price. Engare has some of the most original and fascinating puzzles I've ever experienced, and I can't imagine everyone is going to beat it so quickly without having a lot of previous knowledge about spirographs. Many of the puzzles aren't even spirographs, but involve other interesting patterns that result in beautiful geometry. It also includes some toys that you unlock as you play through the game, and I will most likely go back to experiment with them. It was also an attempt to bring out the beauty of a location which is often represented poorly in video games, and I believe it succeeded.

39083630.review: Súper bonito, para sentarte un rato y relajarte. Corto porque tiene que ser corto, merece mucho la pena y no estaría tan bien si durara más en mi opinión.

39075103.review: A small, beautiful puzzle game reminiscent of Ancient Greek Geometry (https://sciencevsmagic.net/geo/), but with music and animation and more playfulness.

39029262.review: Amazing innovative puzzle game with great music. Hooks you right in from the start and a pleasure to play all the way through, Highly recommended, worth the price tag!

39027067.review: best puzzle game i've ever played. This game is a great way to understand perfection of islamic art

38969791.review:
Cute puzzle game.

It's called "Engare" which is Persian for "idea". Basically it's a soothing but stimulating puzzle game made my a bunch of Iranians about spirographs and traditional Middle Eastern architecture set to Persian classical music. If you look hard enough at the resulting spirographs, you can see carpet medallions, the inner ceilings and outer domes of famous mosques from Iran, clothing patterns, and so on. 

It's quite unique, I can't think of anything that immediately reminds me of this game. But it's quite simple, too.
